simple.gui.factory

Class SwingFactory

  • java.lang.Object
    • simple.gui.factory.SwingFactory

  • public final class SwingFactory
extends Object
    Common Swing creation functions. (No dependents)
    Created: Mar 6, 2009
    Author:
    Kenneth Pierce

    • Method Detail

      • getFileName

        public static String getFileName(Component parent)
        Opens a JFileChooser and returns the result.
        author Rana Bhattacharyya
        Parameters:
        parent - Component to center on.
        Returns:
        String of the file's path or null if no file was selected.

      • getFileName

        public static File getFileName(Component parent,
               FileFilter filter)
        Parameters:
        parent - Component to center on.
        filter - Filter to use for filtering displayed files.
        Returns:
        Resulting file or null if none were selected or box was closed by means other than the Open button.

        Opens a JFileChooser and returns the result.
        Adapted from code by Rana Bhattacharyya
        Parameters:
        parent - Component to center on.
        Returns:
        String of the file's path or null if no file was selected.

        Opens a JFileChooser and returns the result.
        Adapted from code by Rana Bhattacharyya
        Parameters:
        parent - Component to center on.
        Returns:
        String of the directory path or null if nothing was selected or box closed abnormally.

        Returns:

        Update component look & feel.
        Updates the look and feel of the JFileChoosers only.

      • makeDefaultJFrame

        public static JFrame makeDefaultJFrame()
        Calls makeDefaultJFrame(String, int, int) with an empty title and a width and height of 300.
        Returns:
        An empty JFrame of size 300x300 that exits when closed.

      • makeDefaultJFrame

        public static JFrame makeDefaultJFrame(String title)
        Calls makeDefaultJFrame(String, int, int) with the specified title and a width and height of 300.
        Parameters:
        title - Title for the frame.
        Returns:
        An empty JFrame with a set title that exits when closed.

      • makeDefaultJFrame

        public static JFrame makeDefaultJFrame(String title,
                       int width,
                       int height)
        Creates a JFrame that exits when closed with the specified title, width, and height.
        Parameters:
        title - Title for the frame.
        width - Width of the frame.
        height - Height of the frame.
        Returns:
        An empty JFrame with a set title that exits when closed.

      • showFrame

        public static void showFrame(JFrame frame)
        Sets up a frame and displays it. Calls the following methods on frame:
        frame.pack();
        frame.setLocationRelativeTo(null);
        frame.setVisible(true);
        Parameters:
        frame - JFrame to be setup and shown.

      • makeJFrameAndShow

        public static JFrame makeJFrameAndShow(String title,
                       Container content)
        Creates, sets the content pane, centers, and shows the frame.
        Parameters:
        title - Title for the frame.
        content - The content pane.
        Returns:
        The created frame.

      • makeJFrameAndShow

        public static JFrame makeJFrameAndShow(String title,
                       int width,
                       int height,
                       Container content)
        Creates, sets the content pane, centers, and shows the frame.
        Parameters:
        title - Title for the frame.
        width - Width for the frame.
        height - Height for the frame.
        content - The content pane.
        Returns:
        The created frame.

      • makeJButton

        public static JButton makeJButton(String display,
                  String actionCommand)
        Creates a JButton with common properties already set.
        Parameters:
        display - The text to be displayed on the button.
        actionCommand - The action command to be set with JButton.setActionCommand(String)
        Returns:
        JButton with text display and actionCommand actionCommand
        See Also:
        AbstractButton

      • makeJButton

        public static JButton makeJButton(String display,
                  String actionCommand,
                  ActionListener al)
        Creates a JButton with common properties already set.
        Parameters:
        display - The text to be displayed on the button.
        actionCommand - The action command to be set with JButton.setActionCommand(String)
        al - ActionListener to be added to the resulting JButton.
        Returns:
        JButton with text display and actionCommand actionCommand
        See Also:
        AbstractButton

      • makeJLabels

        public static JLabel[] makeJLabels(String[] vals)
        Returns a JLabel for each element in vals.
        Parameters:
        vals - Text to be displayed.
        Returns:
        An array of JLabels with text from vals.
        null if vals==null

      • getActionCommand

        public static String getActionCommand(EventObject e)
        Retrieves the set action command from an EventObject if it is an AbstractButton or subclass.
        Parameters:
        e - EventObject trigger.
        Returns:
        if e.getSource() instanceof AbstractButton then AbstractButton.getActionCommand()
        null otherwise.
        See Also:
        AbstractButton

      • addTitledBorder

        public static JComponent addTitledBorder(JComponent c,
                         String title)
        Calls JComponent.setBorder(new TitledBorder(new EmptyBorder(0,0,0,0),title)).
        Parameters:
        c - JComponent to add the TitledBorder to.
        title - The title to be set.
        Returns:
        The JComponent after setting a TitledBorder using an EmptyBorder and giving it title title.
        See Also:
        JComponent, BorderFactory

      • addBorder

        public static JComponent addBorder(JComponent c,
                   Border b)
        Added for chaining calls on anonymous JComponents.
        Parameters:
        c - The component to get the border
        b - The border
        Returns:
        The passed component
